entity.name: Interop issues
entity.description: Browser support issues, implementation bugs, cross‑browser implementation differences or inconsistencies, browser prioritization, speed of adoption of new features, any issues where specific browsers, browser engines, or browser companies are mentioned (and it’s not to praise them).
entity.descriptionClean: Browser support issues, implementation bugs, cross‑browser implementation differences or inconsistencies, browser prioritization, speed of adoption of new features, any issues where specific browsers, browser engines, or browser companies are mentioned (and it’s not to praise them).

entity.name: Specific platforms & vendors
entity.description: Issues mentioning specific platforms, operating systems, or browser vendors.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues mentioning specific platforms, operating systems, or browser vendors.

entity.name: Apple
entity.description: Issues specific to Apple as a platform or vendor, and the Apple ecosystem (e.g., Safari, WebKit, iOS).
entity.descriptionClean: Issues specific to Apple as a platform or vendor, and the Apple ecosystem (e.g., Safari, WebKit, iOS).

entity.name: Microsoft
entity.description: Issues specific to Microsoft as a platform or vendor.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues specific to Microsoft as a platform or vendor.

entity.name: DX
entity.description: Learnability, API ergonomics (DX), cognitive overhead, things being too low-level, confusing, annoying, or a hassle.
entity.descriptionClean: Learnability, API ergonomics (DX), cognitive overhead, things being too low-level, confusing, annoying, or a hassle.

entity.name: Excessive complexity
entity.description: Too much complexity
entity.descriptionClean: Too much complexity

entity.name: Poor learnability
entity.description: High learning curve, requires too much knowledge to get started, or too much information to memorize.
entity.descriptionClean: High learning curve, requires too much knowledge to get started, or too much information to memorize.

entity.name: Security & privacy
entity.description: Lack of security and privacy
entity.descriptionClean: Lack of security and privacy

entity.name: Permissions
entity.description: Issues related to the process and UI for requesting, granting, or revoking user permissions for sensitive APIs.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues related to the process and UI for requesting, granting, or revoking user permissions for sensitive APIs.

entity.name: Vendor politics
entity.description: Pain points arising from the strategic decisions, priorities, or market position of browser vendors or platform owners (e.g. Apple, Google).
entity.descriptionClean: Pain points arising from the strategic decisions, priorities, or market position of browser vendors or platform owners (e.g. Apple, Google).

entity.name: PWA Installation
entity.description: Pain points specifically related to the user experience of installing a Progressive Web App.
entity.descriptionClean: Pain points specifically related to the user experience of installing a Progressive Web App.

entity.name: PWA Notifications
entity.description: Issues related to implementing or using push notifications within a Progressive Web App.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues related to implementing or using push notifications within a Progressive Web App.

entity.name: PWA Monetization
entity.description: Difficulties monetizing Progressive Web Apps, particularly in comparison to native apps.
entity.descriptionClean: Difficulties monetizing Progressive Web Apps, particularly in comparison to native apps.

entity.name: Education
entity.description: Issues related to learning new technologies
entity.descriptionClean: Issues related to learning new technologies

entity.name: Lack of documentation
entity.description: Lack of documentation or code examples
entity.descriptionClean: Lack of documentation or code examples

entity.name: Environments & Consumers
entity.description: Issues relevant to specific environments or consumers of web content, e.g. devices, bots, viewing modes, etc.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues relevant to specific environments or consumers of web content, e.g. devices, bots, viewing modes, etc.

entity.name: Mobile vs Desktop
entity.description: Challenges around supporting both mobile and desktop, but not specifically about either of the two.
entity.descriptionClean: Challenges around supporting both mobile and desktop, but not specifically about either of the two.

entity.name: Reliability
entity.description: Crashes, device/context loss, flaky behavior, and error handling.
entity.descriptionClean: Crashes, device/context loss, flaky behavior, and error handling.

entity.name: End-user experience
entity.description: Issues around difficulties providing a good user experience for end-users. Do not include DX issues here (use `ergonomics` for that).
entity.descriptionHtml: Issues around difficulties providing a good user experience for end-users. Do not include DX issues here (use ergonomics for that).
entity.descriptionClean: Issues around difficulties providing a good user experience for end-users. Do not include DX issues here (use ergonomics for that).

entity.name: Web Share API
entity.description: Exposes a mechanism for sharing content to various user-selected targets.
entity.descriptionClean: Exposes a mechanism for sharing content to various user-selected targets.

resources.title: Integrate with the OS sharing UI with the Web Share API

webFeature.description_html: The navigator.share() method invokes the device's native sharing mechanism and passes text, links, files, and other content to share targets.
webFeature.name: navigator.share()

entity.name: Persistent Storage
entity.description: The need for client-side storage that is guaranteed to persist and not be evicted by the browser's clearing mechanisms.
entity.descriptionHtml: The need for client-side storage that is guaranteed to persist and not be evicted by the browser's clearing mechanisms.
entity.descriptionClean: The need for client-side storage that is guaranteed to persist and not be evicted by the browser's clearing mechanisms.

entity.name: IndexedDB
entity.description: Issues specific to the IndexedDB API.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues specific to the IndexedDB API.

entity.name: Secure Storage
entity.description: Issues related to securely storing sensitive information, such as cryptographic keys, on the client-side.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues related to securely storing sensitive information, such as cryptographic keys, on the client-side.

entity.name: Debugging
entity.description: Debugging issues
entity.descriptionClean: Debugging issues

entity.name: Not applicable
entity.description: No use cases, no pain, no issues.
entity.descriptionClean: No use cases, no pain, no issues.

webFeature.description_html: The capture HTML attribute for <input type="file"> elements allows the user to capture media using the device's camera or microphone.
webFeature.name: HTML media capture

entity.name: Reliance on JavaScript
entity.description: Excessive reliance on JavaScript
entity.descriptionClean: Excessive reliance on JavaScript

entity.name: `PaymentRequest` API
entity.description: Enables a consistent, secure way for websites to request payments using the browser’s native UI.
entity.descriptionClean: Enables a consistent, secure way for websites to request payments using the browser’s native UI.

example.codeHighlighted: const request = new PaymentRequest( [{ supportedMethods: "basic-card" }], { total: { label: "Total", amount: { currency: "USD", value: "9.99" } } } ); let response = await request.show(); response.complete("success"));

webFeature.description_html: The PaymentRequest API prompts the user to make a payment through the browser's user interface.
webFeature.name: Payment request

entity.name: `SpeechRecognition`
entity.description: API that converts microphone input to text.
entity.descriptionClean: API that converts microphone input to text.

example.codeHighlighted: const rec = new SpeechRecognition(); rec.lang = "en-US"; rec.addEventListener("result", e => console.log(e.results[0][0].transcript)); rec.start();

webFeature.description_html: The SpeechRecognition API converts audio into text using the device's speech recognition service.
webFeature.name: Speech recognition

entity.name: Tooling
entity.description: Issues around third party tools, or lack thereof, including tooling in the browser (extensions, devtools, etc.).
entity.descriptionClean: Issues around third party tools, or lack thereof, including tooling in the browser (extensions, devtools, etc.).

entity.name: Performance
entity.description: Performance issues
entity.descriptionClean: Performance issues

entity.name: Workplace issues
entity.description: Issues around getting one’s workplace to agree on certain policies and/or priorities.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues around getting one’s workplace to agree on certain policies and/or priorities.

entity.name: Audio
entity.description: HTML and programmatic audio on the web.
entity.descriptionClean: HTML and programmatic audio on the web.

webFeature.description_html: The navigator.getGamepads() API accesses and responds to signals from game controllers.
webFeature.name: Gamepad

entity.name: Clipboard API
entity.description: Provides the ability to respond to clipboard commands (cut, copy, and paste), as well as to asynchronously read from and write to the system clipboard.
entity.descriptionClean: Provides the ability to respond to clipboard commands (cut, copy, and paste), as well as to asynchronously read from and write to the system clipboard.

webFeature.description_html: The navigator.clipboard API asynchronously reads and writes to the system clipboard.
webFeature.name: Async clipboard

entity.name: macOS
entity.description: Issues specific to macOS as a platform.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues specific to macOS as a platform.

entity.name: DOM APIs
entity.description: Issues related to core DOM manipulation APIs, including issues around creating, updating, or removing DOM nodes via JavaScript APIs.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues related to core DOM manipulation APIs, including issues around creating, updating, or removing DOM nodes via JavaScript APIs.

entity.name: `file_handlers` manifest field
entity.description: Allows PWAs to register themselves as handlers for certain file types.
entity.descriptionClean: Allows PWAs to register themselves as handlers for certain file types.

example.label: manifest.json
example.codeHighlighted: "file_handlers": [{ "action": "/open-file", "accept": { "image/svg+xml": ".svg", "image/png": ".png" } }]

resources.title: File Handling API: Register your PWA as a handler for file types.

webFeature.description_html: The file_handlers web app manifest member registers an installed web app as a handler for files with specific file extensions or MIME types.
webFeature.name: File handlers

entity.name: Meta-issues
entity.description: Meta-issues not intrinsic to the technology itself or its support in browsers (hardware, spec issues, political issues, etc.).
entity.descriptionClean: Meta-issues not intrinsic to the technology itself or its support in browsers (hardware, spec issues, political issues, etc.).

resources.title: The Shape Detection API: a picture is worth a thousand words, faces, and barcodes

entity.name: Low quality results
entity.description: Fidelity issues that are outside the developer’s control or API limitations making it hard to produce high-fidelity results. E.g. rendering is too low quality, low dpi, blurry, browser-generated UI is poor or ugly, etc.
entity.descriptionClean: Fidelity issues that are outside the developer’s control or API limitations making it hard to produce high-fidelity results. E.g. rendering is too low quality, low dpi, blurry, browser-generated UI is poor or ugly, etc.
